column6: “Affordable and walkable location, but treat your room as merely a space to sleep and not much else.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
Booking.com (or Hotel 81) could have told us that the room did not have windows before we booked the room.
Ventilation was poor in the room, and we could not detect an exhaust fan in the toilet, so most of the foul smell from the toilet remained in our room after. :(
column9:
The location was convenient (near Jalan Besar MRT station and walking distance from Rochor MRT station), but it would have been a bit more helpful to publicise that it's more convenient to use Exit B to get to Hotel 81 Dickson.
Used Exit A a few times before realising that Exit B was more convenient in terms of walkability.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 8 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: There wasn’t a fridge in the room and when the bathroom light was on it lit up the room waking the other person who was asleep.
column9: The location was great, you have a train station just across the road and you’re not far from hawker centres and shopping malls.

column7: ['• Family with young children', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: I paid for a room with a window but it’s overlooking the back area of some shops; not a sight to behold. Ok
column9: The close proximity to eateries, shops, mall and the nearest MRT is Rochor which is 2-3min walking. There’s a Chinese restaurant one block away which is 2min walking.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Room had no windows (no natural light to wake you up or to judge the weather). A little noise from the hallway.
column9: Great location! 3 MRT-stations within walking distance. I really love district: little India. Day or night: shops are open, people on the street. If you flight arrives early or leaves late, there is bagage storage, so you don't have to worrie about you baggage while visiting the city.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Superior Twin Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Large groups staying on our floor who used the corridors to socialise meaning that it was very noisy at night and in the mornings.
column9: Paid extra for a room with a window which was nice - good view towards Little India

column6: “The receptions are very helpful and polite.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: There are not much complain about the place, except the price, but we understand that it was a high demand date due to F1 Grand Prix. They were happy to offer us another room when we identified a leakage.
column9: The receptions are very helpful and polite. They upgraded our room based on our request. All in all, we liked our stay in the hotel. The lines are clean, the bathroom also clean. TV was working fine.

column6: “Other than the above the rest all were good.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Although the amenities were okay for the price, I found it little bit untidy. 
On the day one I found a centipede coming out of the bathroom drain hole. And on day 4, the AC was not working through out the night till we checked out the next morning. As we were tired and as it was an odd hour we didn't report it to the receptionist.
As I was travelling with a 2 year old, the above two things annoyed me.
column9: Other than the above the rest all were good. The staff were friendly and helped us out with everything. And even the sheets were changed everyday. We could get the coffee from the opposite shop and it was really close to the MRT and Bus station.

column6: “Great location - dont stay for longer than 1 night though.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The room was incredibly moldy. I honestly believe that staying in this room for more than 1 night is unhealthy for you. There are rooms without window and rooms with window but the windows wont be able to open. The air conditioning cant be adjusted by yourself, you'll have to call reception for that (with a phone that didn't work). There were little flies everywhere. Because of the insufficient opportunities to ventilate the room, the steam of your shower (which is almost directly above the toilet) can't go anywhere.
column9: The location is very nice. It's a small 5 minute walk to the downtown line that brings you to great places. It's walking distance from haji lane and the beautiful mosque and the hotel itself is in little India with lots of restaurants and small stalls.

column6: “A great hotel for tourists who just need a place to sleep in. Comfortable, with pleasant staff”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8: The room had no windows, just huge mirrors covering two walls. When we entered, there was black hair on the floor, in the bathroom, and in that one drawer you have in the room, which threw me off. You can't control the AC, you have to call the front desk and ask them to set the temperature - which we did every day, as it was waaaay too cold for sleeping. Hot water in the shower runs for only 10 minutes after which it becomes barely warm.
column9: The location is good, only 10 minute walk to the Bugis area. It is surrounded by good restaurants, malls, and interesting buildings. The bed was comfy. The staff is very friendly, and ready to help whenever you need anything. If you are visiting Singapore as a tourist, this is a decent hotel - has all the basic amenities, including a tv and a fridge, and if you don't intend to spend your days inside, it's great. Excellent price to quality ratio for Singapore

We got a room with a window, which was relatively dry. However, after we came back from our late dinner, the room was as humid as the others. We checked out after one night.
column9: The staff was the most enjoyable of this hotel, as they all realized this wasn’t up to standard and were very lenient on cancelling the rest of our reservation.

column8:
Room is completely basic. We paid the one to have window. Just for sunlight. No worthy view just Little India store roofs. 
Area is a completely different world than rest Singapore. 
Room was not clean enough. Dust etc around and below the bed. Ants and other small insects seem everyday in the room. 
Bathroom becomes all wet after taking a shower as there is no step to keep water. Could add some tool to push or gather the water at least. 
If you care about feeling comfortable at a hotel, i would suggest stay somewhere else and pay more.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
The biggest problem is that, there is no toilet shower in the toilet. It was totally unexpected for us. The bathroom amenities is only the toothbrush and toothpaste. No soap, shampoo. However they say, the dispenser in the bathroom is multipurpose - works as both Soap & Shampoo !! .
The AC is centrally controlled. Whenever you need to change the temp., you need to call to the reception for that.
Rooms are not soundproofed at all. You can listen whenever someone walk through the corridor. Every time a door lock it makes a big sound, which is clearly audible, which was very problematic.
No room service.
No hotel staff to help with the luggage or anything.
column9:
The Bed size and cleanliness is OK. 
I have met with two receptionist. The male receptionist knows no formalities, did not behave properly. The female one - Min Hui - was helpful in finding attraction tickets and car for airport transfer.
They had luggage storing area.
Location is good for restaurants and MRT.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: in booking app showing including tax but when i reached there staff was asking tax i asked them i booked with tax but staff was asking tax also so i paid there tax
column9: service is ok aircon also ok

column6: “The location of the hotel was INDEED close to Jalan Besar...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: It doesn't have a mini fridge. Other than that, overall is splendid!
column9:
The location of the hotel was INDEED close to Jalan Besar Station (downtown line) and just 2 minutes walk! Thanks for the front person who helped give directions to the mrt station!
Everyone was very kind and helpful! Deffinitely going to stay here again every other months!

column6: “Uncomfortable and disappointing, would not stay again.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Very small room, no space for two large suitcases.  Air conditioner controlled by desk staff, if you needed adjustments you had to contact them.  No shower screen, so water all over bathroom floor didn’t drain quickly so bathroom still wet several hours later.  No just plain tea bags...all tea combined with powered milk.  Bed rock hard.
column9: Not much...no window didn’t know this until we arrived.  Quite no traffic noise.  Staff very helpful.

column6: “The hotel was nice and clean, and had decent staff.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8: Singapore is clearly an expensive city, at my stay here was not cheap, at least compared to other hotels I have booked in Southeast Asia. My room also had no window, which isn't too much of a problem, but something I found made it hard to wake up in the morning.
column9: The hotel was nice and clean, and had decent staff. It was also a 5-minute walk from Jalan Besar MRT station, which is itself barely 10-15 minutes from Marina Bay, making excursions downtown very easy and convenient.

column6: “Convenient location but cleanliness needs to be improved. ”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
1. Dusty phone and floor (behind doors).
2. Doesn’t provide slippers.
3. Shower handle hangs in a weird position. The handle is worn and water were coming out from the side.
column9:
1. Provides hair dryer, toothbrush, toothpaste, towel.
2. Hotel is close to Jalan Besar and Rochor MRT station.
3. Several food stores around that open till late night.
4. Room is cleaned and tidied everyday during your stay.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: The room is quite small and has no windows. The ventilation is also not good - so in combination of the condition of the room, I feel like suffocating. The wall is very thin and you can hear everything outside. The cleanliness could also have been better. We booked this place for 2 nights but had to move to another hotel after the first night because I couldn't sleep.
column9: The location is good - near the subway. The staffs are also very nice.

column6: “It was just sufficient for us to only spend the night in the room for sleep and bath in the morning”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 7 nights']
column8: The Standard double rooms did not have any windows for Ventilation. They were just rooms with good Airconditioning. The rooms can just fit 2 Adults  in a Large bed. We were a family of 4 (2 Adults and 2 kids - 16 and 9 years) and had to book 2 rooms for 7 days, since they were the only ones available. I would suggest to book rooms with Windows if the option is available.
column9: The Locality was excellent. Just a 2 - 5 minutes walk from Jelan Bazar & Rocher MRT stations. Also about 7 minutes walk from Little India MRT station. It was surrounded by many Eateries which offered Indian as well as Local food at much affordable rates. Also very close to a lot of Shopping and Dining activity on Serangoon road on one side and Bencoolen St on the other.  We would start venturing out at 8:30 am and return back after sight seeing at 9:30 PM. So the Rooms were just sufficient for our purpose.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Great location. The room was ready...they allowed early check in as well as late check out free of charge. Room was adequately big ..nice bathroom. Totally worth the money.Og Albert, bugis street market, Mustafa centre all within walking distance.. shopping can be done on spare time.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Very good property... Absolute value for money... Not in the congestion of the Little India area ..the area is good... Great food options around
column9: The hotel rooms are standard. Staff is very helpful. Absolute value for money.... Excellent location

column6: “Good location but room was a let down. ”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Room was very small. Had mould in the bathroom grout and sealing. Ants also present in bathroom. Smelled very strongly like citronella. Noises also carries between rooms.
column9: Staff pleasent, location was handy to town and train stations.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Superior Twin Room', '• Stayed 11 nights']
column8:
Our flight to Singapore was cancelled and I SENT THEM A MESSAGE VIA BOOKING.COM kindly asking them to keep our room until we got on the next flight, but we did not get any response in two days. Two days later, on the day of our rebooked flight, I called from Switzerland (4mins/15€) just to be told that our room wasn't available, and that if we wanted to get a no-window room!? When we finally arrived, two stony faces received us at reception. They gave us a proper room without a fight, but forced us to pay the whole amount of money, as if nothing had happened!
We're disappointed with their way of working. Sometimes we saw 6 people at reception and how on earth no one dared to check my message on booking.com?! If they work with booking.com they should check on their updates on a daily basis. In some countries they would compensate you for all the bother and phone bill we had to go through to supposedly have a "wonderful stay"!
Moreover, they allowed us to check-out until 13.00hrs instead of 11.00h but by 12.00h they called to remind us that we had to leave!? Besides, every weekend there was such a fuss and noise along the corridors that we couldn't sleep! Last but not least, room was too small for two people and the hot water wasn't very hot at all and easily turning from cool to cold!
We would not recommend this hotel to any of our friends, family or colleagues! It was an experience we don't want anybody to go through!
column9: The location in the Little India district is good as there's a metro station next to it, and within 10-15 mins walking distance from the centre of Singapore and Arabic district. Wi-Fi and Air-Con are good. Besides, they always leave you a small bottle of water in room.

column6: “NO COMMENTS for hotel but i love SINGAPORE”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: room are very small and no windows . bathroom are not properly cleaned ... in short i dont like room and hotel smell ....
column9: area ... around the hotel was good and easy approach to mrt and bus stations .. and 24 hours open restaurants are 100m far only.

column8: No complaints
column9:
Room is comfortable. Clean. Lighting is adequate . Brightness is correct. Cozy 
Even though no hand towel was provided the staff are very helpful in giving us extra towel upon request.

column8: Walls are PAPER THIN, didn’t get any sleep! You can hear everything - people snoring, phone alarm going off, and the familes screaming in the hallway don’t help either ....

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 4 nights']
column8: A little of tlc needed, Not quite enough bathroom facilities, in the men's bathroom a shower was constantly running, and one of the two toilets was out of action the whole time we were there. Other bathrooms had leaking taps or showers. Could have been a wee bit cleaner, but was not too bad
column9:
Great location, with heaps of restaurants close by. On the bus route, and with the new tram service running it will be easy to get to, with a short walk from the tram or bus stop.

column6: “The hotel is literally within 2 minutes walking distance...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 8 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Most of the rooms don’t have windows. So without the lights on the room feels pretty much like a grave. So if you are claustrophobic this hotel might not be a great idea. The cleanliness is not quite great. You will find hairs and dust in the corner after the housekeeping ‘swapped’ the room. There were cockroaches in our room but that was taken care of after we informed the front desk. You will not have remote for your room AC. The hotel is centrally Air Conditioned so every time you need to change your room temperature you have to call the reception
column9: The hotel is literally within 2 minutes walking distance from Jalan Besar MRT station, 4 minutes from Rochor MRT and Bus station, 10-15 minutes from Little India MRT and Farrer Park MRT station and Mustafa Centre. It’s within the famous Little India art belt. You can take a lazy walk to Sim Lim Square, Arab street, haji lane and back. You’ll have great and budget food centres around you. There is one Indian food centre and one Chinese food centre just in front of the hotel that are open 24 hours. And the stuff is super friendly and helpful (Except for one grumpy guy)

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: There were no Bidet shower for the commode.
column9: Bed was comfy. Cleanliness was good. House keeping was good. Good Service. We were able to keep our baggages before and after the checking in and check out times respectfully.

column6: “Good if you are on a budget ”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
The cleaning of the room was a little to be desired, underneath the bed was fairly dirty. 
The corridors were quite noisy at night but we used ear plugs and it was fine.
If you can afford a room with windows then definitely do that but if you cannot, and you’re out all day like us, it’s actually quite okay!
column9: It was very close to two metro stops which meant we could get everywhere in the city so easily. There were lots of good food places around us (if you like Indian food) too. The room was spacious and they had the sheets and towels changed daily.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9:
the staff was super friendly, it was our company holiday trip with 20 peoples, and the staff service us perfectly with no hassle.
the hotel near Jalan Besar MRT (downtown line) and lots of cheap restaurant nearby (open 23hours!) 
it was an excellent stay, thank you!

column6: “The location near to MRT station and bus station was very...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The room I was given first was not cleaned. It was stained on the bed spread, dusty on the coffee pot and desk, filthy on the floor, and stinky in the bathroom. I reported to receptionists who gave me another room which was cleaned and no smell. The motor with a high noise level in the bathroom made me restless through all night. Those online photos of the hotel look good, but it was not true. Also the area was depressing. I was wondering whether it would be worthy to stay there.
column9: The location near to MRT station and bus station was very near, so it was easy to travel to the downtown and the airport next day. I was given an extended check out time until 1pm.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: Room service is slow and lousy. Request for clean up during morning, only managed to get by 6pm.
column9: Location. Near to MRT, halal restaurant, convenient store.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: My room had cockroaches in it. I understand this is value for money property, but that does not justify the uncleanliness of the room and the bathroom. The bedsheets were not clean either. When I informed the reception of the insect situation, they offered me an alternate room but I had already unpacked by then and was also about to leave for an entire day of sightseeing. So the reception ensured me of doing a proper cleaning of the room. I don’t know what they did, but it did not work and the cockroaches were still present in the room. I love Singapore and I will visit again, but I will not be staying at this property the next time.
column9: The reason for my second stay was because of the convenient location of the hotel. Rochor and Jalan Besar MRT stations are within 5 minutes walking distance. Mustafa Centre is a 10 minute walk.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']

column9: Location is good. So close to MRT and restaurants

column6: “Not suitable for families and not a pleasant experience”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
The booking at this hotel was done well in advance. At the time of booking, I wrote to them to request early check in. I did not get any response. On the day when we arrived, we were told an extra $68 per room would be applicable. We had no choice as we had just arrived in the country and wanted to rest. So overall it turned out to be expensive.
Rooms have no windows. Bathrooms have moulds.
A slightest sound in the corridor is clearly heard in the room.
Not suitable for families.
Even if you stay for 3 days, the room is not cleaned unless you specificially request it.
column9: On the check out day, they allowed us to keep our luggage to afternoon. This was great service considering the negative experience we had at this property.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Although the lobby is clean the rest of the hotel is filthy. There was hair in our bed on arrival, the bathroom is full of mould, ants and cockroaches. There’s no bath mat so the room because soaking after you’ve had a shower. We were also put in a room with no window but didn’t question it due to our late arrival and being so tired but we heard them doing it to other guests who argued it and were told they could have a window to if they paid extra- seemed a little dodgy.
column9: Location

column9:

Clean rooms ,excellent staff, rooms allocated before check in time.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
The room was smelling like mould, the bathroom have one wall made of glass so if you go toilet in the night and put on the light all the room become bright and the fan in it is very loud likely we have ear plugs.
Also you cannot Controll the aircon so the room is usually freezing and if you want to change that you need to call every time the reception and they will do it for you (boring)...
We stay there 8 nights and for 2 days they didn’t fill up the soap in the bathroom and we were with no toilet paper for one day as well (awful)..
Of course NO breakfast included but at least you get instant tea and coffee in the room every day with a little bottle of water. 
Also cheap room = no windows so very hard to know how is the weather outside..
column9:
If you looking for a cheap accomodation in Singapore with free Wi-fi and Private toilets this hotel is ok.
It is also close to Rochor station MRT.
The reception staff is friendly and helpful.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
I've read the review on this site beforehand, so I came to prepare the worst. Which actually not worst, our experience was quite fine. 
The bathroom, just like the others have said. They didn't separate the shower with the toilet, so it got wet everywhere after you took a shower. 
The room was small, but very decent with the value of money in Singapore. They have no windows though, be careful if you're claustrophobic.
The wall is kind of thin, we could hear when our neighbors came late and bang their doors at wee hours.
You gotta call the reception to change the temperature in the room, it gets cold at night because the room is so small.
column9:
The location is seriously no joke. 
The hotel is super near with Jalan Besar MRT Station. It makes convenient when you take the train from/to the airport. Rochor Station is also nearby, it's only two mins walk I guess. Don't forget the bus stops that are very reachable. A lot of food stalls nearby, you could walk a little and find Bencoolen Street, where there are more cafes and food stations. 
It's also near Bugis street, Haji Lane, Lavender area; you could actually walk there when the weather is really good.
The check in process was very quick, staffs were helpful. Check out process was also the same. We left our luggage after we check out because our flight was at night, and the concierge lady was extremely nice and kind. I didn't get to see her name, but she asked how our trip went by. I am touched :)
Also, the cleaning lady. Even though she's not really good in English, but she's very thoughtful to give us extra towels.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: It is a cheaper hotel in Singapore but it is basic (no window - no fridge in the room). But this is clear when you book so not a negative point.
column9:
The location is good. Close to the metro, a lot of (mostly Indian) restaurants and also a 7eleven.
Check-in was without a smile but other staffs were more friendly.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Room a bit spartan, but ok. Annoying thing with the air condition. Had told the receptionist to turn  it off. But if you remove  the door key from the holder or just leave the room the a/c automatically gets turned on again. I had to get up in the middle of the night to tell the receptionist to turn it off again.

- the hotel isn't sound proofed and so we heard people talking late at night and making noise when we were trying to sleep.
column9: We really liked staying in Little India, it's a really vibrant area and the hotel is situated quite close to Little India metro. The room is basic but a good size and clean. All of the usual amenities are provided (coffee, tea etc) along with two bottles of mineral water. The hotel is quite basic but is a place to lay your head and good if you intend to spend most of your time sightseeing.

On my last night the manager asked if I wanted to switch rooms, which I declined as I couldn’t be bothered to pack just for one night. The children had disappeared that night and it was quiet.
column9:
WiFi was excellent and worked all around hotel. The staff did help with everything I needed but didn’t smile much. I had an issue with the noise from other guests and they offered to move rooms. 
The location was great for the price of the hotel. Close to many shops, eateries, convenience stores and Bugis Street. It was around the corner from the metro which was only 3 stops to ‘bayfront’. Nearby the bus stop for the city hop on bus

column8: Usually Singapore hotels have comment about window if they don't have window. This one didn't have a comment. When I got there, I realized that their standard rooms don't have window. The room had disgusting moldy smell. So I upgraded room with additional 10dollars. The window room didn't have moldy smell but terribly cold. You cannot change the temperature of AC in your room. I asked to reduce AC to the reception but nothing changed. And the reception woman showed us very Singaporean hospitality(means no eye contact, no smile, no greeting, almost throw away my credit card and ID, expedite to move fast...). What a happy trip.

No windows in the room, because of it the bathroom Ares was mouldy and smelly
Hardly any space in the room to move around.
No fridge in the room.
I have emailed you after check in at about 2.30/3.00 am but no response yet from Booking.com
column9:
It has aircondition

column6: “It was a great week. A great place for a solo traveler.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 9 nights']
column8:
Two things:
1. It's not soundproof. You will hear babies cry from another room, children shouting non-stop and people blasting music but it is 97% of the time very quiet.
2. Twice, the housekeepers/cleaners rang my bell despite my Do Not Disturb sign. I panicked as I was naked. Once, I was not in the room but I had my Do Not Disturb sign outside, I came back and found out my room was opened and cleaned. I had to reorganise my stuff because he/she put all of them on the floor (without any damage, though).
column9:
-The staff members are friendly and helpful.
-Checking in/out was a breeze. Quick and easy.
-Good location. Less than 3-minute walk to the nearest MRT station, 7-Eleven, other convenience stores, good local restaurants/pubs and barbershops (great for head massage).
-There's a vending machine outside of the hotel.

column9:
Amazing location. Close to 3 tube stops and the downtown line that will take you to all of the sights. You can get the tube pretty straightforwardly to the airport. Little India is great especially for budget travellers like us as it’s less expensive than the rest of Singapore. If you stay here, eat at the hawkers market at the tekka centre round the corner the food was incredible.
It was super clean, offered free bag storage after check out and great WiFi.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: The only area for improvement I can think of is the central AC regulation. If you wish to turn off the AC for the night, you need to call the reception. Not a big deal, but it would be nice to have AC in your own control :-).
column9: Honestly I think this is the best low budget choice for a 3-night stay in Singapore. Located in Little India neighbourhood, this hotel is a perfect base for exploring this fascinating city. Rochor MRT is just 3min away and Little India MRT is 10min away, so you can't beat the location. The double room without a window was rather basic, but it was very clean (towels and bedding were changed everyday) and all we needed was a decent and inexpensive place to sleep. There are fantastic Indian eateries in the area such as Komala Vilas where you can taste authentic Indian dishes for a price close to nothing. Not to mention countless stalls with fresh veggies and Indian spices. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous, wifi worked well. All in all, a great experience.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: Had a 3 day layover in Singapore to rest and work from my room. Stayed on the ground floor. A large group of people were also booked on the same floor. The noise from these group people in the hallways kept me awake with doors continuously slamming against stoppers in latches and people chatting outside my room. My worst stay in a hotel room for a long time. Wont be back.

column6: “Not as described, not worth the money, and definitely won't be back.”
column7: ['• Group', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8:
Have been using booking for years, and I don't normally leave reviews (especially never a negative review), but this time is too bad experience to not leave a review, so other people is aware of what they are getting. 
Standard Room has NO WINDOW, which was not stated during booking. First room was HUMID with strong MOULD SMELL, so spoke to staff straight away after checking the room, and was given a few other rooms to look. ROOM WITH WINDOW is less humid with less mould smell, however it will COST EXTRA. All other rooms are just as bad, so had to stay in the same room for the first night.
With the ROOM CONDITION mentioned above, both mum and I COULDN'T SLEEP AT ALL even after 8 hours long flight. So again talked to the staff next morning, and was finally given a room less humid and with less smell (no window with no extra charge), was then able to sleep for the next 4 nights... 
Be mindful of what you getting!  (With similar price or a little bit extra, you can get a hotel in much better condition)

column6: “Other than one gripe the Hotel 81 Dickson fulfilled expectations and requirements.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: There being no power connection near the head of the bed. There were several in one place above a small table at the other end of the room. However, an essential piece of medical equipment to facilitate sleep could not be connected as the power connection outlets were too far away. A staff member at reception was asked if the hotel could provide an extension power cord to rectify the issue but even though he knew the purpose of the request he rather dismissively said the hotel had no extension power cord. Really? That's hard to believe. There was no need to forewarn the hotel as every accommodation I've stayed in around the world, be it 1-star or 5-star, always had a power connection outlet near the head of the bed. At the very least, guests would want to recharge their cellphone and have it close to them while sleeping in the event of having to respond to a call or text message.

column8:
1. very noisy. Many travel tours from India, China, and Malaysia stay in the hotel, and they are talked loudly in the aisle.
2. the elevator is terrible. We are locked inside the elevator for almost ten minutes. There is no telephone information inside the elevator. And we pushed the bell button inside it, and the bell is ringed for a long time, but there are no staffs response. Fortunately, the elevator finally slides slowly down to the second floor, and then we go outside. When we told the elevator problem to the staffs at the counter, they just said we would check it, and they did not say sorry or further information.

A very loud family stayed beside our room which badly affected our sleep in the first night. As they gone after the first night, our problem resolved. So please make sure you discuss this while you are checking-in. There are some moderate food places around this hotel. Don't expect too much as this place itself is a cheaper place. Enjoy your stay!

column9: The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Good value for money (considering the average rate of lodging in Singapore). No "inhouse" restaurant but it's okay since they are near many food establishments, even stores. The train station is also walking distance.

column8: The area not good, no wndows in room,  not too many choices of food.  The first room smelled mildew and everything felt damp.  We asked for another room and the a/c worked in this new room, everything felt dry in this new room. When you shower the whole floor gets wet and it makes a mess when you need to use the bathroom.  I suggest a mop or something to dry floor after shower.
column9: Bed was very comfortable and staff was helpful.

column6: “Very close to the subway (two different stations!”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Group', '• Superior Twin Room', '• Stayed 6 nights']
column8:
The hotel was in a bit of a sketchy neighbourhood for Singapore. If you wonder just a little too far from the hotel at night, you might find yourself surrounded by men outside a brothel. 
They refused to give us a second key, although there were two of us staying in the room with vastly different schedules. 
The a/c was controlled centrally and was at times too warm or too cold. 
The bathroom was a wet bathroom, without a separate shower area, so everything in the bathroom got wet when you shower. The hot water turned off within a few minutes every shower. 
There was a mosque close by. The call to prayer early in the morning woke me up several mornings.
column9:
Very close to the subway (two different stations!) and convenient for public transit. 
Cheap and good food close by.

Beds are plastic so rather uncomfortable and  walls are thinner than tissue paper so you can hear everything on the floor. Frequently. Awoken at 2am to guests moving about the floor.

column9: Value for money, a friendly and efficient staff and most of all the excellent location in the middle of everything (Little India, Arab quarter, Bugis Shopping area) are the reasons why I have stayed here for several times now. Do not expect anything else, it is a no thrill deal.

column6: “I won't choose here to stay again.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Special Offer - Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
We stayed there for total 4 nights. We paid full fee on the first day but on the 4th day the staff asked us to pay for another night, we explained to the staff that we paid full fee already but they insist we only paid for 3 nights. 
When I showed them my debit card record on my phone, they still insist we didn't pay. So I had to ask for the key to go back to the room and try to find the receipt. Luckily I found it and showed the staff, they finally stop arguing and apologized.
What annoyed me is what if I couldn't find it?
Would they insist to charge us?
Would it end up with police involved?
Would this trip ended up in police station?
If you would like to risk above all possible situation, please come to this hotel.
BTW,we found blood stain on the towels and brown stain on the sheet more than once while we were staying.
column9: Reasonable price during holidays.

column8: Public toilet is too small and not much clean. As a hotel, they are providing an extra service to keep take care of our baggage if we want more travel once after we checkout until we come back to the hotel to prepare to go to the airport. But we have to pay more to get the room for the refreshment and so the free provided public toilet is too small and it is difficult to at least change our clothes. We suggest for having another room at least the size like of Fitton rooms inside of dress points. If so people may happier and satisfied.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Special Offer - Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Where do I start?! I have been in cleaner, quieter, friendlier and frankly much better hostels! The room we had didn’t have a window, that’s ok we are in a cheap hotel in a city. However the room stank when we first walked in and I mean damp mildewy smokey stink! The shower room was even worse! It was asthough they had employed a blind cleaner who was allergic to cleaning (no offense meant to blind cleaners and people allergic to cleaning). There we hairs all over the shower room floor and I mean obvious, not the casual missed one in the corner, no, there would be less hair on the floor in a salon! There was what looked like nasal excrement smeared up the walls and basically grime in all conceivable places. In fact even places you wouldn’t think there could be grime. The bed was like a bench (now for me personally I like a firm matress, however Donald Trump would have more give on immigration than these stone beauties!) The sheets were that of an incontenant hospital department where if you got in too quick you’d slide across and be off the otherside quicker than a waterpark death slide. The so called fun started when Singatel clearly had a bargain basement deal on for those with Indian mobile numbers, the only issue for us was that the offer only existed in our corridor! The chap was obviously having signal issues though because his receiver obvious couldn’t hear him unless he shouted (either that or he had never been taught about an indoor voice or even the courtesy of having the conversion in your own room). Not that, that would have helped as even the room opposites’ TV echoed beautifully through the corridor and into our room. Now as we are true to our endearing British nature we started with the passive aggressive approach of politely asking whether he knew what the time was and explained we were hoping to be able to sleep.

Brightly cleaned toilet & bathroom with strong water pressure.
Good & fast in-room WiFi.

column9:
The aircon is good, Singapore is hot and it is fit with our needs
Location is excellent for us. Only 2 minutes walk to Rochor MRT and you can go anywhere from here. Bus to Sentosa, Orchard, etc, only half minute walk from the hotel to the nearer bus stop. Anyway if you want to explore Singapore by walking it is perfect as you can reach Bugis, Kp. Glam, Orchard Road, the 24 hour Mustafa Center, all of these places within walking distance and comfortable one. Great experiences. Staff is kind and very helpful.  thanks Hotel 81 Dickson

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Special Offer - Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Due to the nature of the building many rooms have no windows - do not
get one of these rooms! The lack of sunlight meant we would get woken up
by another guest at around 10am or something and after having had a full
10-12hrs sleep we'd feel groggy and exhausted. It was horrible.
Absolutely horrible. We stayed for 5 nights and I would recommend nobody
stay for more than 1-2 nights because the lack of natural light just
made us feel awful and pretty much ruined the last part of our holiday.
There was a strange lack of furniture, so no bedside tables to put things on, only 1 power point near the tv, and the desk the kettle was on was tiny. No fridge to keep milk in so kind of pointless having a kettle. Nearby is no supermarket so it's quite a hike towards the cbd to find a loaf of bread etc. 
You can get cheaper hotel rooms (reasonably cheaper than one here without any windows and much cheaper than one here with windows) a bit further out of the city (but near a train station) such as in Geylang that have a fridge and windows and supermarkets nearby etc. I highly recommend staying somewhere else such as Bright Star.
column9:
There was a hawker stall right on the corner called Economical Curry
Rice (or something similar) run by a lovely woman where you can get a
rice plus 3 choices (meat, veg, tofu, curry) meal for ~$4 which was
tasty and didn't upset our stomachs (we ate there several times),
plus there were heaps of Indian, Indonesian and general halal places in
the area if you're a lover of spicy curry. There's fruit and veg
market stalls a short walk away which were alright.
I'm struggling to think of anything positive to say about the room... it was clean... there was plenty of hand/shower soap provided... the tv worked... That's literally all I can think of.

column8: While the price represented value for money there were some quirks about the room. The room was very tight, not enough room to have 2 medium suitcases open at the same time. You are only given two bath towels and we had to use these to dry the bathroom floor. The walls are paper thin and you could hear everything from the corridor. The mattress is covered with plastic waterproof material this made the sheets slide off when you are in bed, a simple fitted cotton mattress protector would solve this.

column6: “Good location and good value for money in Singapore”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Special Offer - Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
Sometimes noise and loud people can be heard from the inner corridor even during the night, which disturbed the good night sleep.
The aircon was too cold and strong and it couldn't be controlled from the room, only from the reception - this is a bit uncomfortable if someone doesn't like the cold air.
There were some mold stains in the bathroom, otherwise it was clean.
column9: Good location, easily accessible by public transportation, some minutes walking distance from the metro station.  Easy check-in and check-out. There is free luggage storage at the reception where you can leave your luggage after check-out. The room is clean and well-equipped even with kettle and hair dryer. There are free bottles of drinking water in the room which is included in the price. Lift and wifi worked well. The room with window was good value for money in Singapore.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']

column6: “Overall, nice value for money and excellent location and service!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Special Offer - Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: The room is small but it's very affordable so it's okay and expected especially in Singapore where accommodation is very expensive.
column9: Really good location as it is near MRT (5-minute walk if you take Perak Road) and lots of restaurants around the area. The staff is also very helpful and approachable. They clean the room every day even if I did not ask them to which is a good job. They also allow storing luggage if you have a later flight on that day so we were able to maximize our time even after checking out since our flight is in the evening. Nice smelling lobby and hallway too!

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Special Offer - Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
1. Paper-thin walls
2. Inconsiderate staff - played music whilst ‘cleaning’ rooms and had loud conversations all morning - banging and crashing until late into the night. 
3. Bathroom unclean, mouldy and very small. The shower was not a suitable height for my 6ft 3” husband. 
4. Double bed was tiny, only two pillows and the bed sheets were cheap, thin and held no warmth. 
Overall it was the worst place we’ve ever stayed, we were sleep deprived from the noise levels and generally spent 5 very miserable days in Singapore thanks to this disgusting excuse of a hotel.

column6: “2 star excellence in a 5 star location..a quiet side street where the action is!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Deluxe Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: There were no outstanding negatives.
column9:
The hotel is in my very favorite part of Singapore/Little India. It is very close to 
Excellent eateries so one doesn't care that the hotel doesn't serve breakfast. It was
a very clean 2-star hotel in a 5-star location. Tucked into a narrow quiet street so
there was no noise! We took a deluxe  twin room so we got altitude and a window.
There was even a refrigerator! This was $AUD  93
per night saving money that we could use for other things. We chose this hotel because of the good ratings and comments we found on booking.com and were
not disappointed. Honestly when we visit Singapore again,  that's where we'll stay!
I like having a window and the standard rooms do not have one. That would be fine if you're sleeping off jet-lag.

column8: Moldy, gross air conditioning vents. Interior rooms are dark, dank, and full of mildew.  I got sick the air was so gross. Workers were loud and smoking inside. Walls were paper thin and you could hear your neighbor sneeze, or argue and slam doors. I was supposed to stay three nights but left early - booking.com took care of the refund with the property, they wouldn't deal with me directly - still charged me an extra 3% for refund and refunded cash instead of on card I paid with.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Deluxe Double Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: We have no complaints
column9:
Our main aim was to enjoy the many delights that Little India has to offer.
The location of this property was perfect. We also picked this one because feed back from Booking.com clients was good. Thus, for a 2-star hotel, it was truly a great deal. And that's why we're staying there again on the way back through.
We paid a fraction more for a room with a window. If you're jet-lagged and just want to sleep, no need for a window. We Love the views of old Singapore! I attached our view from the 4th floor.There are fabulous and inexpensive eateries all around so it  
doesn't matter that breakfast is not included at the hotel.
